NET INCOME ATTRIBUTABLE TO ACCENTURE PLC

Cost of services before reimbursable expenses

[1] Effective September 1, 2014, we revised the reporting of the Company’s geographic regions as follows: North America (the United States and Canada); Europe; and Growth Markets (Asia Pacific, Latin America, Africa, the Middle East, Russia and Turkey). Fiscal 2014 amounts have been reclassified to conform to the current period presentation. [2] Diluted earnings per share assumes the redemption of all Accenture Holdings plc ordinary shares owned by holders of noncontrolling interests and the exchange of all Accenture Canada Holdings Inc. exchangeable shares for Accenture plc Class A ordinary shares, on a one-for-one basis. The income effect does not take into account “Net income attributable to noncontrolling interests—other,” since those shares are not redeemable or exchangeable for Accenture plc Class A ordinary shares.

column1: [1]  Diluted earnings per share assumes the redemption of all Accenture SCA Class I common shares owned by holders of noncontrolling interests and the exchange of all Accenture Canada Holdings Inc. exchangeable shares for Accenture plc Class A ordinary shares, on a one-for-one basis. The income effect does not take into account “Net income attributable to noncontrolling interests—other,” since those shares are not redeemable or exchangeable for Accenture plc Class A ordinary shares.  [2]  The first and second quarters of fiscal 2014 diluted weighted average Accenture plc Class A ordinary shares have been restated to reflect the impact of the issuance of additional restricted share units to holders of restricted share units in connection with the fiscal 2014 payment of cash dividends. This did not result in a change to previously reported Diluted earnings per share.  [3]  Fiscal 2013 and 2012 diluted weighted average Accenture plc Class A ordinary shares have been restated to reflect the impact of the issuance of additional restricted share units to holders of restricted share units in connection with the fiscal 2014 payment of cash dividends. This did not result in a change to previously reported Diluted earnings per share.  [4]  Fiscal 2013 diluted weighted average Accenture plc Class A ordinary shares have been restated to reflect the impact of the issuance of additional restricted share units to holders of restricted share units in connection with the fiscal 2014 payment of cash dividends. column1: Net income attributable to noncontrolling interests - other

[1]  Diluted earnings per share assumes the redemption of all Accenture SCA Class I common shares owned by holders of noncontrolling interests and the exchange of all Accenture Canada Holdings Inc. exchangeable shares for Accenture plc Class A ordinary shares, on a one-for-one basis. [2]  The first and second quarters of fiscal 2012 diluted weighted average Accenture plc Class A ordinary shares and earnings per share amounts have been restated to reflect the impact of the issuance of additional restricted share units to holders of restricted share units in connection with the fiscal 2012 payment of cash dividends. This did not result in a change to previously reported Diluted earnings per share.  [3]  Fiscal 2011 diluted weighted average Accenture plc Class A ordinary shares and earnings per share amounts have been restated to reflect the impact of the issuance of additional restricted share units to holders of restricted share units in connection with the fiscal 2012 payment of cash dividends. This restatement resulted in a one cent decrease in diluted earnings per share from $3.40 to $3.39 for fiscal 2011.  [4]  Fiscal 2011 and 2010 diluted weighted average Accenture plc Class A ordinary shares and earnings per share amounts have been restated to reflect the impact of the issuance of additional restricted share units to holders of restricted share units in connection with the fiscal 2012 payment of cash dividends. This restatement resulted in a one cent decrease in diluted earnings per share from $3.40 to $3.39 for fiscal 2011.
